thread.title: 13-year-old Texas girl who went missing in Colorado Springs is found on coal train 300 miles away
thread.title_full: 13-year-old Texas girl who went missing in Colorado Springs is found on coal train 300 miles away

author: Jesse Paul
title: 13-year-old Texas girl who went missing in Colorado Springs is found on coal train 300 miles away
text:
A 13-year-old Texas girl who went missing last week while vacationing with her family in Colorado Springs was found safe Monday night on a coal train in a small town some 300 miles away. 
Adalie Rivera, from Lubbock, Texas, was last seen on Friday morning. She was in Colorado staying at the Quality Inn Colorado Springs Airport hotel when she disappeared. 
Lt. Howard Black, a Colorado Springs police spokesman, said the girl somehow ended up on the train in Dumas, Texas — a panhandle town of about 15,000 people more than two hours north of Lubbock — where she was located by law enforcement. 
Black said she was unharmed despite being missing for about four days. Related Articles March 19, 2017 Colorado Springs police searching for Texas teen who went missing while on vacation 
“We’re looking at and trying to understand how she got from Colorado Springs to Dumas,” he said Wednesday morning. “We’re just doing due diligence.” 
One thing investigators are specifically trying to determine, Black said, is whether Adalie had run away or if there was something criminal involved with her disappearance. #CSPD Looking for Missing 13-year old Adalie Rivera https://t.co/rSYJUHJntQ pic.twitter.com/nCctoCsal4 
— Springs Police (@CSPDPIO) March 19, 2017 
There aren’t train tracks close to the Colorado Springs hotel where the teen was staying with her family, though coal trains do travel south along track that’s a few miles away to the south and west. 
Texas authorities referred questions on the case to Colorado Springs police. 
Investigators in Colorado said more details in the case could be released on Wednesday.
